channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Inadequate lighting provision on Northfield Terrace, 21st January
item.description:
There are two streetlights along the length of the Terrace, neither of which provide enough light for residents to safely navigate the street. Combined with potholes, densely-parked cars, drains and litter in the road, it is challenging at night for pedestrians to use the footpath. Please might it be possible for the lighting along the Terrace to be supplemented with a third street lamp installed for continual illumination? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Clarence Square, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Derelict pavement on Northfield Terrace, 21st January
item.description:
The length of the pavement along the Terrace is in poor repair, with inadequately maintained painted double yellow lines, frequent incidence of cracking, rubble and broken tarmac, weeds and disintegration. Please could it be examined for repair as it's unsafe for residents to use and has deteriorated substantially over the past few years. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Clarence Lodge Clarence Square, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven and patchy dangerous roadway surface, 21st January
item.description:
This whole street badly needs resurfacing across the length of it. Residents are finding the potholes a significant trip hazard, especially for young children and those with limited mobility. Would it be possible to raise this for a full resurface please as Northfield Terrace has not had one in many years and is in a state of significant disrepair. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Formosa House Northfield Terrace, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Substantial rubbish dumped along Honeybourne Line, 21st January
item.description:
The resident next to this property has an ongoing issue with the adjacent fence that is badly damaged and supposedly managed by Sanctuary Housing who conducted the development of the estate. There have been multiple incidences of flytipping behind the broken fence as it's open access, and now there's a large amount of construction equipment dumped there and covered with brambles. It seems to be self-exacerbating the longer the rubbish persists there. Would it be possible to take a look to see if it could be cleared? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Marsh Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Honeybourne Line/ Marsh Drive flytipped childs slide, 21st January
item.description:
There's a bright green plastic slide dumped just off the Honeybourne Line that is cracked and damaged, along with some smaller items I can't see from the road. Please could they be removed? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Marsh Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant damage to pavement following line installation, 21st January
item.description:
The recent installation of cables/pipes along Marsh Drive has left the pavement in a really bad state - the surface is uneven and patchy, it looks unattractive and there's a risk of sinkage in due course. The corporate installation workers have not done a great job tidying up after themselves, leaving loose grit and stones and displaced tarmac behind them, and the pavement the whole way along the Drive is in shabby condition. Would it be possible to liaise with whoever conducted this work to raise concerns about this and ensure they repair the damages caused? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Marsh Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on Green on Ashlands Rd, 21st January
item.description:
This rubbish was flytipped quite a while ago and has been reported by resodents to CBC previously via the Report It function on the Council's website. However, as the rubbish remains, there must have been some problem. I'd be grateful if this rubbish could be removed ASAP. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 117 Ashlands Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resurface now, 21st January
item.description:
This main road in and out of cheltenham is an utter disgrace. people are swerving to avoid road breakdown and its damaging to cars. you have to resurface the whole road now. you have a duty of care to maintain and you are failing. all that money to do a bike path but the road is falling to bits.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Campden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poorly maintained footway along Hardwick Green, 21st January
item.description:
This section of land adjoining the Green managed by the University at Hardwick Campus is overgrown, impossible to walk on, covered in brambles and generally impractical for use. It may not be the council's liability, but could be the University's, and it's making it hard for pedestrians to navigate the area especially when a footpath just vanishes. Any help you could offer would be massively appreciated, thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Maidenhorn House Marsh Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on intersection of Marsh Lane and Marsh Gardens, 21st January
item.description:
There's a blind turning off Marsh Gardens and unavoidable potholes which residents are concerned by, as some motorists steer to avoid them so their cars aren't damaged but don't see oncoming traffic as they do so. It's quite unsafe and may need fairly urgent attention to avoid an accident, please could you take a look? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 71 Marsh Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor quality footpath through Elmfield Park, 21st January
item.description:
There isn't a useable pathway through Elmfield that residents can use or acess easily - it's a muddy route that often ices over or becomes unusable in wet weather. Many people walk their dogs along the route but find it slippery or dangerous. Would it be possible to establish a safer pathway for people to use safely? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 76 Marsh Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Toilet and barbeque dumped in Elmfield Park, 21st January
item.description:
There are several bulky items including an old bucket, tarp/patio umbrella, toilet and barbeque abandoned in the corner of the park by Midwinter car park that need addressing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 76 Marsh Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped in Midwinter carpark, 21st January
item.description:
Broken cat carriers, polystyrene sheets and assorted litter in corner of Midwinter. Flytipping is very persistent here with Friends of Elmfield doing monthly litterpicks, so may need routine monitoring if possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Midwinter Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath blocked, 21st January
item.description:
There are large metal posts that are blocking access to the park and to Midwinter Drive - intending to block motorbikes but instead they cause significant access issues for people of limited mobility or with trolleys. Cyclists find it challenging to pass too. Please could a more sensitive approach be investigated? The posts have been in place many years but are causing significant frustration among residents, thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Midwinter Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gritting bin empty, 20th January
item.description:
Ice continually builds up as vehicles go through the ford in School Road adjacent to No. 45. The grit bin has been empty for weeks now and the shovel is missing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 School Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous junction, 20th January
item.description:
Vehicles often fail to give way at this junction for road users on Pittville Crescent Lane. Visibility needs to be improved at this junction especially when coming from Albert Road. It would also help if vehicles stopped parking on the corner, forcing vehicles on the wrong side of the road before pulling out. Not a great place for vulnerable road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Pittville Crescent Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Better safer accessibility, 20th January
item.description:
Can we have a safer crossing please for people who do not use the tunnel? Cycles are not permitted but the road is very busy, some priority crossing would help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 108 Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on path, 20th January
item.description:
As per the title!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 219 Prestbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lane frequently blocked by illegal parking, 20th January
item.description:
Cars/Vans blocking access from deep street into bouncers lane. Cycle path entry is narrow and when someone blocks this, there is no access.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Bouncer's Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inconsiderate and dangerous parking, 20th January
item.description:
Mentioned several times to parents of school children attending St Mary's COE by the local headmaster. He needs more support from councillors and the local Police. As pedestrians we have had numerous near misses with drivers not looking when alighting. The pavement and green areas are damaged badly and looks ugly, all because some don't want to walk a few meters down the road! Laziness has become the new norm. Most drivers who do this just sit in their cars with engines idling and on their phones, something we were told was illegal also!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Bouncer's Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet
